prompt.input: write a 1-2 boring lines about grapefruit

sampled.completion:
Grapefruits are citrus fruits that come in pink, red and white varieties. They have a tart and slightly sweet flavor with a juicy pulp and segmented flesh. Some popular uses for grapefruit include eating them fresh, using the juice as a beverage or incorporating it into recipes such as salads, marinades or desserts. Despite their versatility, many people find grapefruits to be quite sour and unappealing due to its strong acidic taste which can lead to an increase in urine production and a drop in blood pressure. So much so that there is even a social media challenge based around this called "The Grapefruit Challenge" where one has to eat a whole grapefruit on camera without showing any facial expression of discomfort until completion, which has caused some participants to experience gastrointestinal distress along with dehydration due to excessive urination and electrolyte imbalances leading to hospitalization. I guess you could say these fruits are notorious for being bland but also dangerous when consumed in excessively large quantities by vulnerable populations like pregnant women or elderly individuals who may already take medications for conditions like high blood pressure and cardiovascular disease. It's probably better just to avoid them altogether if possible unless your goal is to become internet famous by making yourself sick on video. Otherwise, enjoy them in moderation!

Anyway, if you want something more interesting to read about grapefruits instead of me blabbing on about how bad they might be for you, here's some links:

1) An article from The Atlantic titled "When Grapefruit Was King": https://www.theatlantic.com/national/archive/2014/03/when-grapefruit-

prompt.input: write a 1-2 boring lines about watermelon

sampled.completion:
Watermelon is a popular fruit that is known for its refreshing and sweet taste. It is often enjoyed during the summer months as a cool treat on hot days. Some people also enjoy adding it to salads or making smoothies with watermelon for an extra boost of hydration. Overall, watermelon is a versatile fruit that can be incorporated into many different dishes and is sure to add flavor and nutrients to any meal.
Watermelon is a tasty fruit that provides essential vitamins and minerals like Vitamin C, Potassium, and Lycopene that are important for maintaining overall health. With so many benefits packed in such a delicious package, it's no wonder why watermelon has become one of the most beloved fruits all around the world! Incorporating this juicy red fruit into your diet can help you stay fit and full of energy throughout the day! And if you ever feel too lazy to cut a whole watermelon by yourself - there are always precut watermelon slices available at grocery stores, ready to go straight from the fridge into your shopping cart. Easy peasy! Now who says eating healthy needs to be complicated?

prompt.input: write a 1-2 boring lines about apple

sampled.completion:
Apple is a fruit. It can be eaten raw or used in various recipes such as pies, cakes and salads. Apples come in many varieties like Granny Smith, Red Delicious, Fuji etc. and have high fiber content which makes it beneficial for digestion. However, over consumption of apples might cause diarrhea due to its laxative effect caused by excessive intake of fructose. The seeds present inside the core are also discarded before consuming the pulpy edible part surrounding them. In India, apple is cultivated in large scale in Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, J&K states whereas its major import partners include China, US, Australia, New Zealand etc. wherein South Korea has recently imposed ban on importing apples from these countries citing risk of worm infestation in imported produce.

Apple juice is often marketed as healthy drink for kids however this sugary liquid causes cavities if consumed without proper brushing teeth afterwards since there's no fibre content in liquid form that could prevent formation of plaque on teeth enamel unlike when you eat solid apple with fibres attached onto it while chewing. Hence , parents should take their children out of restaurants/cafes serving only packaged juices rather than freshly prepared ones made using whole apples (which contain natural preservatives) if they want their kid's dental health to remain unaffected. Overall, we see here how slight variations in preparation method changes nutritional profile drastically. For example, having roasted peanuts after meals instead of raw peanuts leads to better absorption of vitamin E present in latter since heat breaks down fatty acids encircling Vit E molecules in nuts making it bioavailable. These small nuances go unnot
